title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is opened in one editor and the user attempts to open the same file in another editor, nothing happens. The workbench does not display any warning or error message.
EB: When a java file is already opened in the workbench and you right-click on it and choose 'Open With ... System Editor', a warning message should be displayed indicating that the file is already opened and asking if you want to continue, Or an error message should state that all files should be closed first.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file.
2. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
3. Go to the Java Perspective.
4. Right-click on the java file and choose 'Open With ... System Editor'.
5. Confirm that no warning message or error message is displayed. It should give a warning message saying that you may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue, or an error message stating that all files should be closed first.
